User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101206 Ubuntu/10.04 (lucid) Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101206 Ubuntu/10.04 (lucid) Firefox/3.6.13

When i do the right click on links or images which are close to the right border of the screen (not firefox window) the item which happens to be under the mouse pointer is "clicked" automatically. When the window occupies only the part of the screen this problem does not appear if the window is far enough from the right border of the screen. My guess is that the problem appears when there is no enough space between the pointer and the right border of the screen to place the menu between them and it is placed under the pointer  (when you right-click the link in the left part of the screen, the menu appears to the right of the pointer).


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Maximize Firefox window
2.Open google.ru for example
3.Try right-clicking the "Войти" button at the top right corner.
Actual Results:  
This time a new window Firefox window was opened.

Expected Results:  
The context menu showing up.

comments.raw_text:
I tried starting Firefox in a safe mode like you said and the problem did not reproduce.
But since i disabled all addons in a startup dialog the context menu got pretty short, so it easily fit in a free space below the mouse pointer (you can see from the video that initially it was rather long).
To check my guess that the described problem is somehow connected with the context menu being placed under the mouse pointer i restarted Firefox in a normal mode and disabled some addons to shorten the context menu and the problem disappeared. 

So i'm pretty much convinced about the source of the problem.
But i'm not sure if it is exclusively a Firefox problem - may be it is graphic toolkit problem (gtk or whatever is used in Firefox) or Gnome or something else. I can't check it because i don't have such long menus in other applications.
Please try installing some addons to reproduce the problem.
